correctness.rationale: Major factual and schema issues. While some fields match the article (PEALD with O2 plasma, DADI/TMGa/DEZ precursors, 250 °C, plasma power 38 W, IGZO 1:1:1 cycle ratio used for optimization, wafer uniformity 1.26%, device Vth ≈ -3.5 V and SS ≈ 230 mV/dec), many values are fabricated, incorrect, or violate the schema: (1) Growth per cycle is wrong: article reports ~0.21 nm/cycle (≈2.1 Å/cycle), but extraction uses 0.21 Å; resulting 100 cycles and 21 nm thickness are inconsistent with the provided GPC and are not reported in the paper. (2) Unsupported/untraceable process parameters: reactor manufacturer (“TFS”) not given; pressure (0.1 mmHg), carrier/purging gas (Ar), dosing/purge times, flow rates, saturation, nucleation period are not reported in the article. (3) Unsupported material properties: refractive index, absorption coefficient, band gap and method, resistivity, carrier density, mobility (Hall), conformality aspect ratio, XPS-based composition and 1:1:1 atomic ratio, roughness, density, crystallinity (XRD) are not reported; article only shows TEM/EDS mapping and device metrics. (4) Unsupported device metrics: field-effect mobility and on/off ratio are not provided in the article. (5) Schema violation: thicknessControl.growthPerCycle contains an extra property filmThickness (not allowed per schema); filmThickness is already (correctly) present at thicknessControl level. To correct: fix GPC to ~2.1 Å/cycle (0.21 nm/cycle), remove or mark unknown all unreported parameters (pressure, gases, times, flows, nucleation, saturation, optical/electrical film properties, XPS composition, roughness, density, mobility, on/off), remove reactor manufacturer or provide the article’s stated info only, and remove the extra filmThickness inside growthPerCycle.

completeness.rationale: Several key fields are correct and traceable (PEALD on TFS200, DADI/TMGa/DEZ precursors, O2 plasma, 250 °C, optimized 38 W plasma power, 1:1:1 subcycle ratio, wafer uniformity 1.26%, device Vth ≈ -3.5 V and SS ≈ 230 mV/dec). However, many values are invented or inconsistent with the article, and multiple described process variants are not captured. Specific issues: (1) Missing processes: the article studies multiple IGZO PEALD conditions (varying In:Ga:Zn cycle ratios and plasma powers). Only one process (1:1:1 at 38 W) is extracted; additional processes reflecting other sequences/ratios and plasma powers should be added. (2) Growth-per-cycle error and inconsistency: article reports ~0.21 nm/cycle; extraction uses 0.21 Å/cycle (10× too low) and pairs it with 100 cycles and a film thickness of 21 nm (internally inconsistent with its own GPC and cycle count, and the article does not report 100 cycles or a 21 nm IGZO thickness). (3) Unsupported process parameters: pressure (0.1 mmHg), carrier/purging gas (Ar), dosing and purge times, flow rates, nucleation period, and saturation are not reported in the article; they appear fabricated and are not traceable. (4) Material properties largely unsupported: refractive index, absorption coefficient, band gap and method, resistivity, carrier density, Hall mobility, conformality aspect ratio, roughness, film density and units, XPS composition and 1:1:1 atomic ratio, and XRD amorphous claim are not provided in the paper. (5) Device metrics: on/off ratio and field-effect mobility are not reported; ION and IOFF values discussed in the article are omitted (schema lacks explicit fields, but the inserted on/off ratio is untraceable). (6) Reactor manufacturer listed as “TFS” (article only says TFS200; likely Beneq), not traceable. Overall, the extraction includes many non-evidenced values and misses the multiple experimental processes; the GPC unit error further reduces coherence. Properties to add/review: add separate processes for different cycle ratios/plasma powers; correct GPC units and reconcile film thickness/cycles; remove or justify unsupported pressure, gases, timings, flows, nucleation; limit material/device properties to those reported (uniformity, possibly amorphous if stated); include reported device metrics (ION, IOFF) if schema permits or omit unverifiable fields.
